title: Data sharing by the Health and Safety enforcement team

content:
Dear Sheffield City Council,
Please consider the following as a request for information under the Freedom of Information Act 2000. It relates to the operations of Sheffield City Council's Health and Safety Enforcement Team, which according to your website is responsible for 'enforcing health and safety standards within certain types of workplace premises and public venues in Sheffield' (
https://www.sheffield.gov.uk/business/he...
).
This request relates to the operations of this team. I am requesting information about this team's relationship with the Home Office Immigration Enforcement department. Please disclose on how many occasions the health and safety team has
1) carried out a joint inspection with Home Office Immigration Enforcement
2) shared data with Home Office Immigration Enforcement
Please disclose the requested data for 2018, 2019, 2022, 2021, 2022 and from 1 January 2023 to the date on which this request is responded to.
Yours faithfully,
Mary Atkinson

Dear Mary Atkinson,
Thank you for your request for information relating to data sharing by the
Health and Safety enforcement team which we received on 19/04/2023.
As your request is a request for information relating to the environment,
this has been logged as a request under the Environmental Information
Regulations 2004 (EIR) and will be dealt with under the Regulations. The
reference number for your request can be found above.
The Environmental Information Regulations 2004 state that we must respond
to you within 20 working days, by 19/05/2023, but we kindly ask for your
patience as we anticipate that there may be a delay in some cases. Please
do not hesitate to contact us at the email address below if you have any
queries.
Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
Email: [1][Sheffield City Council request email]
From: Chai Patel <[FOI #973254 email]>
Sent: Wednesday, April 19, 2023 11:37 AM
To: FOI <[Sheffield City Council request email]>
Subject: Freedom of Information request - Data sharing by the Health and
Safety enforcement team

Please consider the following as a request for information under the

website is responsible for 'enforcing health and safety standards within

).
This request relates to the operations of this team. I am requesting
information about this team's relationship with the Home Office
Immigration Enforcement department. Please disclose on how many occasions
the health and safety team has
1) carried out a joint inspection with Home Office Immigration Enforcement
2) shared data with Home Office Immigration Enforcement
Please disclose the requested data for 2018, 2019, 2022, 2021, 2022 and
from 1 January 2023 to the date on which this request is responded to.
Yours faithfully,
Mary Atkinson

Dear Mary Atkinson,
Thank you for your request for information relating to data sharing by the
Health and Safety enforcement team which we received on 19/04/2023.
Please find Sheffield City Council’s response to your request set out
below:
We hold no information with regard to both your questions.
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
The information provided in this response is available for re-use under
the terms of the Open Government Licence v3.0. The terms of the OGL can be
found [1]here. When re-using the information, Sheffield City Council
requires you to include the following attribution statement: “Contains
public sector information obtained from Sheffield City Council and
licensed under the Open Government Licence v3.0.”
If you are unhappy with the response you have received in relation to your
request, you are entitled to have this reviewed. You can ask for an
internal review by replying to this email. Internal review requests should
be submitted within 40 working days from the date of this response.
If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you
can contact the Information Commissioner’s Office. Please see
[2]
https://ico.org.uk/make-a-complaint/offi...
for further details.
Kind Regards,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
Email: [3][Sheffield City Council request email]
From: FOI
Sent: Friday, April 21, 2023 11:00 AM
To: Chai Patel <[FOI #973254 email]>
Subject: Re – Environmental Information Regulations Request – Reference –
EIR / 856563
